subject: Law
title: Trademark Infringement and Confusion
description: A short lesson to help you apply Trademark Infringement and Confusion.

hook.text: A store called 'Starbuds Coffee' opens down the street from Starbucks. Is that infringement?

buildup.text: Trademark infringement occurs when someone uses a similar mark in a way that creates consumer confusion.

discovery.text: Courts analyze several factors: similarity of marks, proximity of goods, and evidence of actual confusion.

twist.text: You can use someone's trademark to discuss their product. Comparative advertising is legal if truthful.

climax.text: Famous marks get extra protection against 'dilution'‚Äîeven without confusion, weakening a famous brand is actionable.

punchline.text: If customers might be confused, the trademark owner has a case.

quiz.question: What is the key test for trademark infringement?
options: Whether there's likelihood of consumer confusion
Whether both businesses are in the same city
